items: The Northwestern University Summer Writers’ Conference will return in Summer 2021
HippoCamp 2020 was canceled due the COVID-19 pandemic. We’re sad.
HippoCamp 2016 [note: this site is currently experiencing server issues]
Presenters are responsible for bringing their own handouts (if applicable).
There is a maximum of two presenters for break-out sessions and one presenter for flash sessions.
Presenters must agree to adhere to our conference code of conduct.
Opening reception (heavy appetizers and cash bar; one drink on us w/ a ticket)
An Abbreviated Version of or 2022 Call for Proposals

To discuss: Please read each of these essays and write down:
A draft of your lyric essay is due for the lyric essay workshop. Here are your options:
Excerpt from The Body by Jenny Boully (handout)
We will review these subcategories and the lyric essay as a genre in greater length next week.
Here are your reading assignments, below:
Seneca Review’s Introduction to the Lyric Essay
“On the Lyric Essay” by Ben Marcus
Bodies of Text: On the Lyric Essay by Amy Bonnaffons
Writer Michael Martone’s Leftover Water by Patrick Madden
Finding a Form Before a Form Finds You by Patrick Madden
First: Have a great spring break!
A note on the personal reported essay:
Workshops for the external essay will be held on March 30.
Assignment No. 3: Additional reading for March 23:
Your midterm assignment is due in class on Friday, March 9
• the exercise itself with instructions (employ what is known as process writing to some degree)
• Susan Orlean interview (The New New Journalism, handout)
• Nieman Storyboard, “Why Is This So Good?” Susan Orlean’s “The Orchid Thief.”
• interview with Ted Conover (The New New Journalism, handout)
Critical response paper due in class.
Dee, you will need to do your mid-term presentation in class on Friday, March 2 as discussed.
